Package src

Interface weighted_graph

All Known Implementing Classes:
WGraph_DS
public interface weighted_graph
This interface represents an undirectional weighted graph. It should support a large number of nodes (over 10^6, with average degree of 10). The implementation should be based on an efficient compact representation (should NOT be based on a n*n matrix).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addNode​(int key)
    add a new node to the graph with the given key.
    void connect​(int node1, int node2, double w)
    Connect an edge between node1 and node2, with an edge with weight >=0.
    int edgeSize()
    return the number of edges (undirectional graph).
    double getEdge​(int node1, int node2)
    return the weight if the edge (node1, node1).
    int getMC()
    return the Mode Count - for testing changes in the graph.
    node_info getNode​(int key)
    return the node_data by the node_id,
    java.util.Collection<node_info> getV()
    This method return a pointer (shallow copy) for a Collection representing all the nodes in the graph.
    java.util.Collection<node_info> getV​(int node_id)
    This method returns a Collection containing all the nodes connected to node_id Note: this method can run in O(k) time, k - being the degree of node_id.
    boolean hasEdge​(int node1, int node2)
    return true iff (if and only if) there is an edge between node1 and node2 Note: this method should run in O(1) time.
    int nodeSize()
    return the number of vertices (nodes) in the graph.
    void removeEdge​(int node1, int node2)
    Delete the edge from the graph, Note: this method should run in O(1) time.
    node_info removeNode​(int key)
    Delete the node (with the given ID) from the graph - and removes all edges which starts or ends at this node.

      double getEdge​(int node1, int node2)

    • addNode

      void addNode​(int key)
      add a new node to the graph with the given key. Note: this method should run in O(1) time. Note2: if there is already a node with such a key -> no action should be performed.
      Parameters:
      key -

    • connect

      void connect​(int node1, int node2, double w)
      Connect an edge between node1 and node2, with an edge with weight >=0. Note: this method should run in O(1) time. Note2: if the edge node1-node2 already exists - the method simply updates the weight of the edge.

    • getV

      Returns:

    • getV

      java.util.Collection<node_info> getV​(int node_id)
      This method returns a Collection containing all the nodes connected to node_id Note: this method can run in O(k) time, k - being the degree of node_id.
      Returns:
      Collection

    • removeNode

      node_info removeNode​(int key)
      Delete the node (with the given ID) from the graph - and removes all edges which starts or ends at this node. This method should run in O(n), |V|=n, as all the edges should be removed.
      Parameters:
      key -
      Returns:
      the data of the removed node (null if none).

    • getMC

      int getMC()
      return the Mode Count - for testing changes in the graph. Any change in the inner state of the graph should cause an increment in the ModeCount
